column4: try installing gnome-alsamixer and turning up pcm.  this is known to help with crackling issues.
: how do you turn up pcm?
run gnome-alsamixer and you should have a slider for PCM.
of course you have to install it first (sudo apt-get gnome-alsamixer)
: nope the PCM slide was up when i opened it , it still has the cracking sound
is it a constant crackling, or an occsional pop/crack sound?
: That does not work either .. does it help if tell you the laptop make ?
I'm trying to find the original instrux I used to fix my problem....just a sec
I found the original instrux and they just say to comment out that line.  You might try restarting pulseaudio by typing pulseaudio -k in a terminal and then restart it by hitting alt
: do i have to install pulseaudio first?
Did you remove it?  I believe (somebody correct me if I'm wrong)it's installed by default
were you able to restart pulseaudio?

: yeah  i was but still the cracking sound does not go away , you mentioned it is a power save problem , i dont know if this helps but when i installed 9.10 i have to turn acpi=off could that be the problem?
honestly, I don't know if turning acpi off would have an effect.  I just know the line you have to comment out as I suggested is related to power save.
sorry I wasn't of more help...u might want to look at this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1311207
